message:
I have a question regarding document.referrer in JS. So imagine you clicked over a link from google that redirected you to another page where you called document.referral, I assume you would get something like this back: "www.google.com"

Now what if you clicked on an ad? What value would you get?
And what if when you were creating that google add, you listed your page as: www.mypage.com/?tag=my_tag instead of www.mypage.com

Would that tag show anywhere?
story: Mohamed Moshrif shared a link to the group: Egyptian Geeks.
name: Google
caption: google.com
description: Search the world's information, including webpages, images, videos and more. Google has many special features to help you find exactly what you're looking for.

data.message:
I guess you need to grab the http referral header

Using backend languages
